page.title: 08LUDWORTH SCHOOL
page.content: The present school in Ludworth, was built in the l930's. The age range of the children is from 3 to 11 years. The school has 4 classes, 1 nursery, 1 infant, one junior/infant, and 1 junior class. There are a head teacher, four teachers and a nursery nurse. There are also a number of domestic staff, including a caretaker, a cleaner, a cook and assistant, and two lunchtime supervisory assitants, and a clerk. State schooling first began in Ludworth in 1876, and apart from a short break in 1970, when the present building was being modernised, has continued uninterrupted to the present year. Shadforth/Ludworth County Junior Mixed and Infant School is run by the County Council of Durham Education Department.
